oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 12 from oral history interview with Kenneth L. Roberts, 2006 July 27
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville business and civic leader Kenneth L. Roberts, conducted on 27 July 2006 by Cabot Pyle as part of the Nashville Public Library's Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project: The Turner Interviews. Roberts discusses buildings in downtown Nashville, particularly bank buildings, and how buildings started to change or were lost after the advent of HUD. He particularly mentions the L & C building and the First American Bank building. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Roberts, Kenneth L., 1932- --Interviews
United States. Dept. of Housing and Urban Development; Life and Casualty Insurance Company of Tennessee; First American Bank (Nashville, Tenn.)
